primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: A life of virtue (Lowell Zuck) is presented as the embodiment of the Pauline 'new self', serving as a model for the community and a bridge to the mystery of God.

tekstueel_bewijs: Lowell who was attuned to the mystery of God
he had already done the work of resonance with the intent of God
he lived his life... attuned to the mystery of God

object.identificatie: The 'New Self' / Attunement with God / Ethical Legacy
tekstueel_bewijs: clothe yourselves with the new self
resonance with the intent of God

zender.identificatie: The German Evangelical Tradition / Paul (as Lawgiver)
tekstueel_bewijs: He taught us that the tradition... yields a community
Paul wrote to remind the church
a reminder and a summons to us
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Does hearer identify with Subject or Receiver?

tekstueel_bewijs: He brought to the faculty uncommon gifts of mind
the tradition in which the seminary stands yields a community
helper.rol_van_god: God is largely the Object of attunement rather than the Subject of action.

tekstueel_bewijs: corrupt and deluded by its lusts
the rough and tumble of faculty life
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is framed as 'bad habits' or 'rough faculty life' rather than an ontological power of Sin.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God welcoming the believer into eternity.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: God
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: God's welcome is presented as contingent upon the primary program's success (Lowell's 'work of resonance').

voorbeelden_god_subject: God in Christ has forgiven you
voorbeelden_mens_subject: he had already done the work of resonance

voorbeelden: You were taught to put away your former way of life
a summons to us about what a new life can look like
He taught us that the tradition...
Lowell knew that in his bones!
capable of anger but not sinning

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon assumes that knowing the tradition (Savoir) and observing a model (Lowell) provides the impetus for the obligation (Devoir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From the 'Old Self' of faculty conflict to the 'New Self' of Lowell's character.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in human imitation of a virtuous model.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Low; S2 is treated as manageable character flaws.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is a classic example of 'Exemplarism'. Lowell Zuck replaces Christ as the primary Subject of the narrative. Grace is mentioned but functions as a reward for 'resonance'.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: surely there are some who are more easily welcomed... because he had already done the work of resonance

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: as God in Christ has forgiven you

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Lowell is the 'incarnation' of the Pauline text, making the text about human capability.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: God is the one who 'clothed' Lowell, making Lowell a witness to God's power rather than his own 'work of resonance'.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to achieve 'resonance' to be 'easily welcomed' by God.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Highly coherent as a eulogy, but theologically incoherent regarding the 'unconditional' nature of grace.
spanning_punten: The quote 'God welcomes all' vs 'some are more easily welcomed'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: his very person is a reminder and a summons to us

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is mentioned in the text but not as the active agent of Lowell's transformation.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Low; sin is 'evil talk' or 'bitterness' that can be 'put away' by effort.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is driven by Lowell's agency. God is a passive observer who 'welcomes' based on prior human work.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: Lowell is the subject of 'resonance' and 'attunement'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: God as the Subject who 'fashioned' Lowell.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: God's grace was so active in Lowell that it produced a resonance with the divine intent.

identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as 'Receiver of the same Grace'.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Focus on the 'Seal of the Spirit' as a gift rather than a character trait.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Emphasize that the 'New Self' is 'created' (passive for man) by God.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Identify the 'Old Self' as a death-grip only God can break.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: To make the 'New Self' a miracle of grace rather than a result of 'puckish good humor'.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: Ethics (Lowell's life) precedes and justifies Soteriology (God's welcome).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: God's mercy → Lowell's transformation → Our hope.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: While a moving tribute to a colleague, the sermon structurally replaces the Gospel with a 'Gospel of Character'.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, it is elegant; semiotically, it is anthropocentric.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis uses the text, but the actantial roles reverse Paul's emphasis on God's 'sealing'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas exposes that 'God' is the Object being 'attained' by the Subject (Lowell), rather than the Subject seeking the Object (Man).

appendices.notities: The sermon functions as a 'canonization' of a person rather than a proclamation of a Savior.
